fact.translated: Le nom kiao vient de la prononciation Teochew de 饺 (mandarin : jiǎo ; 'ravioli').

fact.original: These wontons became popular at many Chinese-American restaurants.
fact.translated: Ces wontons sont devenus populaires dans de nombreux restaurants sino-américains.

fact.original: This folding technique creates an impression of crossed arms/hands.
fact.translated: Эта техника складывания создает впечатление перекрещенных рук/ладоней.

entries.src_context: ['The wonton skin is initially folded into a right triangle.', 'Each end of the hypotenuse is pressed against the middle of opposite sides.', 'This folding technique creates an impression of crossed arms/hands.']

fact.original: Wonton strips are a common complimentary appetizer in American-style Chinese restaurants.
fact.translated: Хрустящие ломтики вонтон являются популярной бесплатной закуской в китайских ресторанах американского стиля.

entries.src_context: ['Wonton strips are deep-fried strips made from wonton wrappers.', 'Wonton strips are served with hot mustard or other dipping sauce.', 'Wonton strips are a common complimentary appetizer in American-style Chinese restaurants.']

fact.original: The name 'folded arms' comes from the way the wonton skin is folded.
fact.translated: Название "согнутые руки" происходит от того, как складывается тесто для вонтона.

entries.src_context: ['The smallest serving of wontons and noodles is called sai yung and consists of two wontons.', "In Sichuan, semi-pentagonal wontons are known as 'folded arms' (Chinese: 抄手; pinyin: chāo shǒu).", "The name 'folded arms' comes from the way the wonton skin is folded."]

fact.original: The soup is very famous in Thailand.
fact.translated: Суп очень знаменит в Таиланде.

entries.src_context: ['The soup is made with chicken stock.', 'The wontons in the soup are made with a pork filling.', 'The soup is very famous in Thailand.']

fact.original: Wontons are served in a variety of sizes.
fact.translated: Вонтон подают в различных размерах.

entries.src_context: ['Wonton noodles may also be consumed with red vinegar.', 'The soup for wonton noodles is made from boiling shrimp shells, pork bones, and dried flounder to give it a distinct taste.', 'Wontons are served in a variety of sizes.']

fact.original: In Thailand, wontons are called kiao (เกี๊ยว, pronounced [kía̯w]).
fact.translated: В Тайланде вареники называются кяо (เกี๊ยว, произносится [kía̯w]).

fact.original: 'Three delicacies wonton' contains pork, shrimp, and beef liver as primary ingredients.
fact.translated: 'Три деликатеса вонтон' содержит свинину, креветки и говяжью печень в качестве основных ингредиентов.

fact.original: Wontons from the 7th and 8th centuries CE were found in Turpan.
fact.translated: Вонтонпы 7-го и 8-го веков нашей эры были найдены в Турпане.

fact.original: Each region of China has its own variations of wonton.
fact.translated: Каждый регион Китая имеет свои варианты пельменей вонтоны.

entries.src_context: ['Xiao huntun are invariably served in a soup.', 'The soup often includes condiments such as pickles, ginger, sesame oil, and cilantro (coriander leaves).', 'Each region of China has its own variations of wonton.']

fact.original: Wonton with noodles is called dry wanton mee in Singapore.

fact.original: A version of fried wontons filled with cream cheese and crab filling is called crab rangoon.
fact.translated: Версия жареных вонਥонов с начинкой из крем-сыра и крабов называется краб рагун.

entries.src_context: ['Fried wontons are served with a meat filling, usually pork.', 'Fried wontons are eaten with duck sauce, plum sauce, sweet and sour sauce, or hot mustard.', 'A version of fried wontons filled with cream cheese and crab filling is called crab rangoon.']

fact.original: Pancit Molo is named after the Molo district of Iloilo City.
fact.translated: Панцит Моло назван в честь района Моло в Iloilo City.

fact.original: Wonton wrappers in the broth serve as the noodles in pancit Molo.
fact.translated: Обертки для вареников в бульоне выступают в качестве лапши в пансит Моло.

fact.original: The soup for big wontons will usually be matched with a thin egg omelette, seaweed, mustard greens, and shrimp.
fact.translated: Суп для больших хрустящих пельменей обычно подается с тонким яичным омлетом, морскими водорослями, горчичной зеленью и креветками.

entries.src_context: ['Big wontons are a large ingot shape.', 'Big wontons are generally boiled.', 'The soup for big wontons will usually be matched with a thin egg omelette, seaweed, mustard greens, and shrimp.']

fact.original: These wontons became popular at many Chinese-American restaurants.
fact.translated: Эти пельмени стали популярными во многих китайско-американских ресторанах.

fact.original: In Chifa, fried wontons with meat filling are eaten with rice or Tallarín saltado.

fact.translated: Вонтоны обычно встречаются в региональных стилях китайской кухни.

entries.src_context: ['A wonton (traditional Chinese: 餛飩; simplified Chinese: 馄饨; pinyin: húntun; Jyutping: wan4 tan4) is a type of Chinese dumpling.', 'Wontons are commonly found across regional styles of Chinese cuisine.']

fact.original: There are many different styles of wonton served throughout China.
fact.translated: Существуют многие разные стили приготовления вонтонов, которые подают по всему Китаю.

entries.src_context: ['Wonton is also spelled wantan or wuntun in transliteration from Cantonese 雲吞 / 云吞 (wan4 tan1).', 'Wonton is also spelled wenden from Shanghainese 餛飩 / 馄饨 (hhun den).', 'There are many different styles of wonton served throughout China.']

fact.original: Cantonese wontons are the most popular in the West.
fact.translated: Кантонские вонтончики самые популярные на Западе.

entries.src_context: ['Wonton is also spelled wenden from Shanghainese 餛飩 / 馄饨 (hhun den).', 'There are many different styles of wonton served throughout China.', 'Cantonese wontons are the most popular in the West.']

fact.translated: Вонтонны отмечаются и наслаждаются в различных кулинарных традициях Юго-Восточной Азии.

fact.translated: Преобладание кантонских ресторанов за границей способствует популярности кантонских вареников в Западе.

fact.original: Commonly, they are handmade at the point of sale in markets or small restaurants by the proprietor while awaiting customers.
fact.translated: 通常，它们在市场或小餐馆的销售点由店主手工制作，等待顾客。

fact.original: Moistening can be done by dipping a fingertip into water and running it across the dry dough to dissolve the extra flour.
fact.translated: 湿润可以通过将指尖浸入水中，然后在干面团上轻轻滑动以溶解多余的面粉来完成。

fact.translated: 作为密封过程的一部分，空气被挤出内部。

fact.translated: 馄饨通过用手指将饺子皮的边缘压在一起封口，形成所需的形状。

fact.translated: 排出空气可以避免在烹饪时由于内部压力而导致云吞破裂。

fact.original: From the time of the Tang dynasty, the Chinese began to differentiate the names of dumplings (jiaozi) and wontons.

fact.original: The ancient Han Chinese thought wonton were a sealed bun, lacking 'qi qiao' ('seven orifices').
